channel.title: Areithe Beta Testing
channel.description:
It was sent to the first testers. The rest of you will need to re-apply to be a beta tester. We will be CAREFULLY excepting about 8 or so more members to test. Thanks, G.A.S.P Staff ©
That is right. We have finally finished our game ;D (or at least put it into Beta). But anyways we need approximatly 8 more people to help us test, so I thought I would post this here so you can: 1.) Get into testing 2.) If you do not get into testing, stick around and wait for Public Beta The link to the forums (which I think is approved) is this: http://z10.invisionfree.com/Areithe/index.php? NOTE: You must register and be active in order to Beta Test

item.title: Areithe Beta Testing
item.dc:creator: @Akriam Akriam
item.description:
@Akriam wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:34, topic:42837”][quote author=g00dg0d link=topic=59762.msg733838#msg733838 date=1167939327]
Akriam doesnt know anything about C++ so we wont be making one for awhile.
[/quote]

In that case, -.-

I wouldn’t be too concerned about switching over, that’ll be another 2 years of work :P[/quote]

He doesn’t know what he is talking about:

//First C++ Program

#include <iostream>
#include <string>
using namespace std;

int main ()
{
	int a, b, c;
	int result;

	a = 2;
	b = 3;
	c = a+b;
	result = a + b - c;

	sting mystring = "Hello, I am a C++ program!";

	cout << mystring << endl;
	cout << "I was created by Akriam!";
	cout << "I will do some math for you!";
	cout << "2+3-5=.....";
	cout << "I got it!";
	cout << "The answer is....";
	cout << result;
	return 0;
}

I’ve been doing my studying ^.^ Its not much, but what did you excpect for 5 minutes?

Read full topic

item.title: Areithe Beta Testing
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Blender and Milkshape are plenty good enough to start with.

If you’re going to switch to C++ eventually, you want to do it now. Rewriting the client when your game gets bigger is going to be horrible.

Read full topic

item.title: Areithe Beta Testing
item.dc:creator: @Akriam Akriam
item.description:
@Akriam wrote:

Thanks for all the suggestions, as Jme_009 said, we are taking it slow and smartly, we are not ging to blow alot of money, untill we have alot of money to blow. Then we will probably code the game like Mopar suggested.

Also Mopman, I have blender and Milkshape, but when we are going to sit down and make a really really good MMORPG, we are going to use C++/maybe Java, so we want top of the line equipment.

G00g0d, we can’t use illegal copies once our game gets noticed. :p[br][size=1]Posted on: January 03, 2007, 06:34:00 PM[/size][hr][quote=“alexia, post:22, topic:42837”]Sounds pretty cool. Any chance you could post a few pictures from the game?

-Alexia[/quote]

Ill see if I can find a link, but you might have to be registerd to see them.

Read full topic

item.title: Areithe Beta Testing
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Going from Blitzbasic to your own OpenGL-based engine would be a quick way to kill the project, in my opinion. However let us not forget about the many cross-platform 3d engines we have available. I recommend Irrlicht or OGRE.

Read full topic

item.title: Areithe Beta Testing
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:23, topic:42837”]Just some suggestion’s for you.

Code the server in something fast and linux friendly, such as c++.

For the client make sure you program it in something platform independent, now whether you want to write it in java, or very carefully write it in c++ using a library such as opengl would be up to you, but a cross platform compatible client would make your game go much further in my opinion.[/quote]

alritghe sorry i cant talk right now im so baked and drunk but anyways the engine they are usin is extremely damn slow and it is windows only.

but like he said they might port it to c__ or something so yeah…

Read full topic

item.title: Areithe Beta Testing
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Just some suggestion’s for you.

Code the server in something fast and linux friendly, such as c++.

For the client make sure you program it in something platform independent, now whether you want to write it in java, or very carefully write it in c++ using a library such as opengl would be up to you, but a cross platform compatible client would make your game go much further in my opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: Areithe Beta Testing
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Ehm…

Areithe in general has nothing too special, but I do however support the “staff” all the way, and commence them for taking on the project.

It has potential, I mean my project was similar in many ways, and thousands had joined our forums. If we didn’t prune members who dont post within 30 days of joining, there would have been at least 2000-3000 members. The main thing that brought us down was lack of money(we spent a lot on it, so dont get me wrong), the other leader being a complete ass and pretty much a scammer, and I grew bored of it after a year and a half of development. Also we ripped too many things and it gave us a pretty bad name quickly. Fortunatly, Areithe is ran by intelligent people(unlike everyother rc or other engine games), and they haven’t been following in any bad foot steps.

I don’t really have much to say though, I’m in a rush and shouldn’t even be on these forums at the moment, lol.

edit: Oh now I remember what I was going to say… At first glance it does appear like every other mmo thats in development. But after spending time with the community there are some interesting concepts to the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Areithe Beta Testing
item.dc:creator: @Akriam Akriam
item.description:
@Akriam wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:17, topic:42837”]Why would C++ be expensive? Unless you mean hiring coders?

It may be true that no successful MMORPG has been written in Blitz - all you’ve gotta do is drop the first M. A MMORPG cannot be created/maintained by two people (RS would appear to be an exception) - however, a “Multiplayer Online RPG” can.[/quote]

If we want to make a quality game with all the right softwarz it does. 3DS MAX alone is like 3,000 dollars…

Read full topic

[/quote]

Not anymore lol <3 G00dg0d[/quote]

Also mopman I am also one of the people making there 3!! much better lol. And since it wasnt even a closed beta till today I dont think we will have to worry about maintaining anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Areithe Beta Testing
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Why would C++ be expensive? Unless you mean hiring coders?

It may be true that no successful MMORPG has been written in Blitz - all you’ve gotta do is drop the first M. A MMORPG cannot be created/maintained by two people (RS would appear to be an exception) - however, a “Multiplayer Online RPG” can.

Read full topic

item.title: Areithe Beta Testing
item.dc:creator: @Akriam Akriam
item.description:
@Akriam wrote:

Oh hell, I know the flaws of Blitz. I never wanted to do it in blitz, but the fact is two teenage kids do not have a couple thousands of dollars to throw around, so we are waiting a little bit to move it to the C++ stage, where we can really start making a great game. As for talking bad about my game, I know where you are coming from, but please don’t do it…as weibs said.

@Aftermath - I believe I have posted it like three times and Mopar never said anything + I have had it in my signature. I believe mopar even posted on a topic about my game a wile back, so I think it is okay. Anyways ask weibs, it is nothing bad.

Read full topic
